Variable.desc: Table containing each application's name and it's desired configuration. The
Variable.desc_gfm: Table containing each application's name and it's desired configuration. The
Variable.doc:
Table containing each application's name and it's desired configuration. The
key of each entry is the name of the App as it appears in the title bar, and
the value is a configuration table with the following entries:
    * title - String with title text to display in the menu bar icon itself
    * action - String with action to take on window when showing. See constants.
Variable.doc_gfm: Table containing each application's name and it's desired configuration. The key of each entry is the name of the App as it appears in the title bar, and the value is a configuration table with the following entries: * title - String with title text to display in the menu bar icon itself * action - String with action to take on window when showing. See constants.
Variable.name: apps
Variable.stripped_doc:
key of each entry is the name of the App as it appears in the title bar, and
the value is a configuration table with the following entries:
    * title - String with title text to display in the menu bar icon itself
    * action - String with action to take on window when showing. See constants.

desc: Control applications from the macOS Menu Bar
desc_gfm: Control applications from the macOS Menu Bar
doc_gfm:
Control applications from the macOS Menu Bar

Download: https://github.com/adammillerio/Spoons/raw/main/Spoons/MenuBarApps.spoon.zip

Example Usage (Using SpoonInstall): Create a "P" menu bar item that opens and moves Plexamp and create a "D" menu bar item that opens and maximizes Discord. spoon.SpoonInstall:andUse( "MenuBarApps", { config = { apps = { ["Plexamp"] = { title = "P", action = "move" }, ["Discord"] = { title = "D", action = "maximize" } } }, start = true } )

desc: Name and switch Mission Control spaces in the menu bar
desc_gfm: Name and switch Mission Control spaces in the menu bar
doc:
Name and switch Mission Control spaces in the menu bar

Download: https://github.com/adammillerio/Spoons/raw/main/Spoons/Spacer.spoon.zip

Example Usage (Using [SpoonInstall](https://zzamboni.org/post/using-spoons-in-hammerspoon/)):
spoon.SpoonInstall:andUse(
  "Spacer",
  {
    start = true
  }
)

Space names can be changed from the menubar by holding Alt while selecting
the desired space to rename. These are persisted between launches via the
hs.settings module.

Variable.desc: Main hs.window.filter. This is what is used to enumerate and maintain the window
Variable.desc_gfm: Main hs.window.filter. This is what is used to enumerate and maintain the window
Variable.doc:
Main hs.window.filter. This is what is used to enumerate and maintain the window
cache. It is a copy of the "default" window filter with WindowCache specific
sort order and callback configurations applied in the start method.
Variable.doc_gfm: Main hs.window.filter. This is what is used to enumerate and maintain the window cache. It is a copy of the "default" window filter with WindowCache specific sort order and callback configurations applied in the start method.
Variable.name: windowFilter
Variable.stripped_doc:
cache. It is a copy of the "default" window filter with WindowCache specific
sort order and callback configurations applied in the start method.

doc:
Utility for quickly retrieving windows

Download: https://github.com/adammillerio/Spoons/raw/main/Spoons/WindowCache.spoon.zip

This uses a hs.window.filter to maintain a Least Recently Used cache which
can be searched either by window title or application name. This is useful
for automations which benefit from quick access to windows.

This was implemented based entirely off of the source of
[hs_select_window.spoon](https://github.com/dmgerman/hs_select_window.spoon)
and split out to be used across other Spoons.

Example Usage (Using [SpoonInstall](https://zzamboni.org/post/using-spoons-in-hammerspoon/)):
spoon.SpoonInstall:andUse(
  "WindowCache",
  {
    start = true
  }
)
doc_gfm:
Utility for quickly retrieving windows

Download: https://github.com/adammillerio/Spoons/raw/main/Spoons/WindowCache.spoon.zip

This uses a hs.window.filter to maintain a Least Recently Used cache which can be searched either by window title or application name. This is useful for automations which benefit from quick access to windows.

This was implemented based entirely off of the source of hs_select_window.spoon and split out to be used across other Spoons.

Example Usage (Using SpoonInstall): spoon.SpoonInstall:andUse( "WindowCache", { start = true } )

items.desc: Main hs.window.filter. This is what is used to enumerate and maintain the window
items.desc_gfm: Main hs.window.filter. This is what is used to enumerate and maintain the window
items.doc:
Main hs.window.filter. This is what is used to enumerate and maintain the window
cache. It is a copy of the "default" window filter with WindowCache specific
sort order and callback configurations applied in the start method.
items.doc_gfm: Main hs.window.filter. This is what is used to enumerate and maintain the window cache. It is a copy of the "default" window filter with WindowCache specific sort order and callback configurations applied in the start method.

cache. It is a copy of the "default" window filter with WindowCache specific
sort order and callback configurations applied in the start method.

name: WindowCache
stripped_doc:
Download: https://github.com/adammillerio/Spoons/raw/main/Spoons/WindowCache.spoon.zip

This uses a hs.window.filter to maintain a Least Recently Used cache which
can be searched either by window title or application name. This is useful
for automations which benefit from quick access to windows.

This was implemented based entirely off of the source of
[hs_select_window.spoon](https://github.com/dmgerman/hs_select_window.spoon)
and split out to be used across other Spoons.

Example Usage (Using [SpoonInstall](https://zzamboni.org/post/using-spoons-in-hammerspoon/)):
spoon.SpoonInstall:andUse(
  "WindowCache",
  {
    start = true
  }
)
